p: In addition to hematological detection and nucleic acid testing, serological diagnosis is important for patients who present late with a very low viral load, below the detection limit of RT-PCR assays [ 59]. IgM and IgG titers were relatively increased on day 5 and rapidly raised 10Â days after symptom onset in most patients [ 59, 60]. The IgM-positive rate increased from 50 to 94%, whereas the IgG-positive rate increased from 81 to 100% [ 60]. In addition, the IgM- and IgG-positive rates were not significantly different before and after patients were found to be virally negative [ 61]. Therefore, virus-specific IgM and IgG serological testing may be used to confirm current or previous infection with SARS-CoV-2.
